intro: Bupleurum falcatum f. eudiversifolium, commonly known as the European cow parsley, is a variant of the common valerian. It is a biennial plant characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. It is native to Europe and thrives in moist, shady environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental addition to gardens and natural habitats.
